intro: Crinita punctata, commonly known as the punctate crinita, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
